block.p: SAFEGUARD SCIENTIFICS INC., Wayne, Pa., said it had raised $50 million each from Compaq Computer Corp., Houston, and International Business Machines Corp., Armonk, N.Y., and formed strategic relationships with both companies.

MAGAININ PHARMACEUTICALS INC., Plymouth Meeting, Pa., a biotechnology company, said Genentech Inc., South San Francisco, Calif., would pay it as much as $60 million to help develop an asthma-related antibody and pay $5.5 million for a 3.2 percent stake in the company.

LUBRIZOL CORP., Cleveland, said it would form a joint venture with GE Transportation Systems, Erie, Pa., to develop and sell products to manage diesel engine fluids for the railroad and mining industries.
AFLAC INC., Columbus, Ga., the parent of American Family Life Assurance Co., said it planned to repurchase up to 10 million shares over an unspecified time.
